intro: Phyllocoryne jamaicensis, commonly known as the Jamaican sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments. Its flowers are often pink or red and attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Phyllocoryne jamaicensis plays a role in local ecosystems and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
